cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles east of Melbourne, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast then accelerating northeast, paralleling the Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coastline and passing near or just east of the North Carolina Outer Banks before curving seaward
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: closest coastal approach near the Outer Banks of North Carolina (Surf City–Duck area) rather than a true landfall

weather_observation.watch_coast: Surf City to Duck, NC including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east-central coast northward through the Carolinas and the broader southeast & mid-Atlantic shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty northeast winds possible Monday night–Tuesday (generally ≤ 20 kt, well below tropical-storm force).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; minor tidal departures possible but <3 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain bands may bring around 1 inch, locally 2 inches to central Maryland Tuesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and long-period swells could produce rough Chesapeake Bay and harbor conditions, increasing wave action on exposed berths and restricting small-craft operations.
